personal.name: Amos Cohen
personal.title: Product Manager
personal.profile: I am a driven product creator with diverse experience in engineering, design, and business. My track record includes solving complex problems and navigating technical challenges using logic and self-learning. I love cooking Middle Eastern food, listening to music, and playing CS:GO in my free time.

responsibilities: Established enterprise experience as a Product Manager for Deloitte Digital by creating proprietary products for the firm that generate revenue or save costs

Led a 12-person cross-functional team in delivering a SaaS product, helping our clients adapt to new data protection regulations while maintaining advertising returns, resulting in a new revenue stream for Deloitte

Led a 10-person team to transition an internal product (automated software meant to amplify the way we view our clients’ digital assets and accelerate response time) from proof-of-concept to MVP in 3 months. As a result, we delivered reliable and consistent actionable insights and increased the product's internal usage, being involved in millions of dollars worth of revenue
Owned product in an agile workstream for a healthcare Salesforce implementation project.
Managed end-to-end delivery of web services for 20+ clients in Europe and Israel, from concept to production
Designed and developed 12+ high-performing ecommerce experiences for businesses of various scales, using WordPress or Shopify to adapt to changing demand for custom solutions
Championed a user-centric approach to web development, resulting in a 20% reduction in cycle time and a 15% increase in clients' LTV

Provided programming support to over 1200 collegiate athlete website. I effectively communicated with customer support representatives who provided me with technical issues raised by clients and implemented accordingly.
Implemented ADA-compliant code written in HTML and C# for over 50% of the company’s portfolio, resulting in WCGAG AA compliance.
Assisted the Director of BXLP SU in consulting to student-startups in different stages (ideation, acceleration, investment).

Prepared students for pitch competitions and guided founders to create investment-ready assets for their ventures, primarily business plan componentes. Three of those startups were funded with over $2M seed investments.
K&P is a family business in Israel which imported foods from Italy and Sweden and resold to large retailers and wholesalers.

Prepared students for pitch competitions and guided founders to create investment-ready assets for their ventures, primarily business plan componentes. Three of those startups were funded with over $2M seed investments.

Developed and implemented a cost-effective logistics strategy to optimize supply chain operations, reducing transportation costs by 15% and improving delivery times by 20% for K&P's Swedish food imports.
Successfully negotiated and executed a white labeling agreement with a large retailer, increasing brand exposure and revenue for K&P's imported food products.
Served as Commander, Sergeant and Company Sergeant Major. I commanded 6 cycles of new recruits in different roles over the course of 3 years, leading and guiding hundreds of new recruits.
